questionsData.explain_answer: . The quantum theory, is a theory about light .

questionsData.title: . Rough surfaces scatter the light less than smooth ones
questionsData.explain_answer:
No, Rough surfaces scatter light more than smooth ones . 

  • On a smooth, flat surface, the light all bounces off in the same direction, according to the angle it hit the surface (this is called specular reflection). Like a mirror reflecting your image.
  • On a rough surface,  sending the reflected light bouncing off in lots of different directions (this is called diffuse reflection).these angles are different because the surface scatters the light.

questionsData.title: . On the pH scale, distilled water has a value of eight
" turn over the soil" means " plough"
.A concave lens makes objects look larger
…..Where does the Bactrian camel mainly live? In
questionsData.article: Camels belong to the same family as Ilamas, alpacas and guanaces. However, camels are distinguished from Ilamas, which are larger than alpacas, by their largest size.There are two types of camels: the Arabian camel, or dromedary, which has a single hump, and the Bactrian, or Asian camel, which has two humps on its back. The Arabian camel lives mainly in the Middle East, Africa and India, whereas the Bactrian lives in the high lands of central Asia. Camels stand on four flat feet, each foot has two hoofed toes. An adult camel weighs 650 kg and about 2 meters tall. The hump, which is made of fat is used to store water and food.

questionsData.title: Have the children …… their hands before eating.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.

questionsData.title: . Listen! She's ……. with the audience
questionsData.explain_answer: The sentence "Listen! She's speaking with the audience" is in the present continuous tense. In this tense, the verb "to be" (in this case, "is") is combined with the present participle form of the verb "speak" (speaking). This tense is used to describe an action that is happening at the present moment or around the present time. In the given sentence.

questionsData.title: . Afnan is ….. than Amal
. is (NOT) a compound word ……
..... apple a day keeps a doctor a way .
The thick fog ….. to clear tomorrow .
questionsData.explain_answer:
The verb to be + to + infinitive

Ex:

: The President is to meet the ambassador tomorrow.
The thick fog is to clear this afternoon.
You can use these structure to talk about future plans or forecasts. You often see it in newspaper.

questionsData.title: He …. his homework an houfinishedr ago .
questionsData.explain_answer: The sentence "He finished his homework an hour ago" is in the past simple tense. In this tense, the verb "finish" is in the past form (finished) .

. She had a stomachache ……. she visited the doctor

. I wish I ….. swim
. Birds are …… in feathers
questionsData.explain_answer:
The best word to fill the blank is:

  • Covered

Here's why:

  • Covered is the past participle of the verb "to cover" and implies a complete encasement. This accurately describes how feathers are on a bird's body.

questionsData.title: . The place ….. we buy bread from is called a bakery
questionsData.explain_answer:
. The place which  we buy bread from is called a bakery.

note: If there was an option where that could be true too and best.

"Which" is used to refer to things or animals, sometimes places.

"Whom" is used as a relative pronoun to refer to people, not places.

"When" is used to refer to a time or a point in time.

"Who" is used as a relative pronoun to refer to people.
